comment: Dr. Echols is one of the tougher professors I have had. She does like group projects and has a very clear grading criteria. You miss to turn in an assignment on time and you lose points. She is caring, however, and would give an opportunity to make-up 1 assignment but that is all. No extra credit is offered and book is used to some extent.
Dr. Echols helps you understand why things matter. The course content is stuff you kinda know but she makes it relevant. She tells the truth which is not always easy to hear,

Okay we were forced to take this class because we were in the "Thrive" Program. This class is really terrible, she doesn't give any clear communication, she will always try to one up you on everything you have done, she is a bit of a racist so be very carful about what you say. My advise DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!

she is a terrible grader. the group project that she assigns is over a pointless topic. She does give yo time out of class to work on it but that is still not enough time to complete the assignment to her satisfaction. if you have a choice of any other professor take them. AVOID THIS TEACHER AT ALL COST.

Dr. Echols takes grades on attendance so go to class. She isn't very clear on how she grades things, so when you get your paper back, 50% of it is highlighted. Group projects are on pointless topics that get graded harshly. She lectures most all of the classes so it's hard to stay interested. The class is made harder than it needs to be.

Dr. Echols is a great professor! She uses real life experiences to connect with the course criteria. She likes to work remotely which has been very convenient for those who have a full time job and are full time students. Very understanding and has a cute laugh. I wish she taught more classes at KSU!!

Going to class is a waste of time, that's why she takes attendance points. Everything is done online. It's easy, but you won't learn anything and she grades terribly on your group project; she's inconsistent, late-causing trouble completing your next part, and not very understanding. Good point-she does give days off for group work.

She was late to class, would send 5 emails correcting herself, didn't pay attention to campus policy (she scheduled class during finals week), wouldn't respond to emails, gave ridiculous assignments that had nothing to do with class, and graded many students harshly based on opinion expressed. Don't take her if you can help it.
